result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle J Leaman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 7/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 2 days jail for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle J Leaman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Nick Martinez in court.   Defendant Michelle J Leaman did not appear.   Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amend count #2 to a county ordinance.  Attorney Martinez enters a no contest plea on behalf of his client.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  
Court orders the following:  FORFEITURE:  $267.50 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 a month commencing 7/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in 2 days jail.
Jury status hearing on June 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle J Leaman in court with attorney Nick Martinez.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises they wish to go to trial.   Other acts evidence affidavit reviewed by the Court.  Parties make statements.  Court will allow evidence at trial as stated.  Attorney Osborne moves for an adjournment.  Attorney Martinez objects.  Court grants the request for the adjournment of the trial. Speedy Trial Demand requested.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called for a motion to admit other acts evidence.  Defendant Michelle J Leaman in court with attorney Nick Martinez.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Attorney Osborne makes statements.  Court will allow the other acts evidence be allowed at trial contingent upon the defense provides sufficient notice.
Motion hearing on April 18, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
to Admit Other Acts Evidence, filed by Atty nicholas Martinez
Jury trial - 12 person on April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michelle J Leaman in court with attorney Nick Martinez.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez moves for additional time to file a motion. Deadline to file motions is 3/28/2016.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michelle J Leaman in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez has received an offer and discovery is provided by the State in Court. Attorney Martinez to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing and file any motions.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Christopher D listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Michelle J Leaman in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.     NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
